- NHANES. In an earlier [post](/posts/2025-09-07_gamlss/) I talked about the [National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey](https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/nhanes/) (NHANES). Weights discussed in the [NHANES study design tutorial](https://wwwn.cdc.gov/nchs/nhanes/tutorials/sampledesign.aspx) 

- SIH. [Survey of Income and Housing](https://www.abs.gov.au/statistics/detailed-methodology-information/concepts-sources-methods/survey-income-and-housing-user-guide-australia/2019-20) has a [weights](https://www.abs.gov.au/statistics/detailed-methodology-information/concepts-sources-methods/survey-income-and-housing-user-guide-australia/2019-20/weights) page

## References

- The [survey](https://cran.r-project.org/package=survey) R package by Thomas Lumley

- [How to weight a survey](https://bookdown.org/jespasareig/Book_How_to_weight_a_survey/) by Josep Espasa Reig

- [How different weighting methods work](https://www.pewresearch.org/methods/2018/01/26/how-different-weighting-methods-work/) from the Pew Research Center

- [Survey analysis](https://epirhandbook.com/en/new_pages/survey_analysis.html) chapter from The Epidemiologist R handbook
